instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Need J9510 for a 820-3662
threads.message:
Hi folks,

Can someone point me to a site/service where I can find this part? Searched on eBay etc but can't find the connector. Taking from a donor board is not an option as it it either melts or never comes off and I'm done wrecking boards for connectors I destroy anyway. Any help appreciated!

threads.title: Need J9510 for a 820-3662
threads.message: Can't find em either. Have you tried heating from the bottom to take it off a donor?

threads.title: Need J9510 for a 820-3662
threads.message: Was gonna say exactly what Atomrepair just said lol just use heat from the bottom of a donor and put in on the new board. Way easier than sourcing one

threads.title: Need J9510 for a 820-3662
threads.message: Removing this from a donor is absolutely no problem with bottom heat and carefully applied top heat and taking your time.

threads.title: Need J9510 for a 820-3662
threads.message: never done this actually, wondering how you heat both sides, not simultaneously I guess?

threads.title: Need J9510 for a 820-3662
threads.message: Yes simultaneously, just use a preheater...

threads.title: Need J9510 for a 820-3662
threads.message:
I've got one in great condition if you'd still like one, and are located in the US.
